go_data.justification: VAMP2 mediates fusion of synaptic vesicles to release neurotransmitters by binding with its partners syntaxin-1A and synaptosomal-associated protein 25 (SNAP25).
VAMP2 is essential for vesicular exocytosis and activity-dependent neurotransmitter release through the fusion of synaptic vesicles.
VAMP2 is a neuronal v-SNARE located on the vesicle membrane and is essential for the fusion of synaptic vesicles at mammalian central nerve terminals.
VAMP2 mediates fusion of synaptic vesicles to release neurotransmitters.
VAMP2 plays fundamental roles in vesicle fusion, neurotransmitter release, and vesicle endocytosis, exerting a complex influence on synaptic transmission.
